1.content:
Welcome!

Before anything, which gender do you want to pick?
1.title: But First...

choices: Alec, the Typhlosion in search of direction
Jirachi, the mythical wish granter who wants a better sleep schedule
11.content:
Alright then!

How about Joel, a kind Arcanine man of 43 years who's been described as "dad-like" in terms of both appearance and personality?

Or maybe Alex, a Gardevoir whose idea of enjoying college is taking full advantage of his androgynous looks to mess with others.

Then again, you might prefer Alec. He's a Typhlosion in his second semester of college and is trying to figure out what he wants to do with himself.

And if you prefer your guys on the more mythical side, there's always Jirachi. Always taking on a new name every time he wakes up (if just for the fun of it), he always tries to make the most of his week before reluctantly falling asleep for another thousand years.

Any of these guys strike your fancy?
11.title: Male Options

111.content:
Life has been pretty fair to Joel in his 43 years of living. He lives in a nice apartment in Celadon City, has a nice job managing the Game Corner, and never has to want for anything.

At least, that's what he'd tell you.

And he wouldn't be entirely wrong. He's lived an average life, nothing special, but one blessed enough to shape him into a total sweetheart. Maybe even a pushover. Maybe. Just a little bit.

But what he wouldn't tell you is that he feels lonely. Not due to a lack of friends or acquaintances, he has those. Joel's problem is that he's never found that special someone. And at his age, he finds that incredibly embarrassing. So much so that he avoids the topic altogether. He hasn't quite given up the search, but he's not exactly trying all that hard either. Chalk it up to a lack of confidence.

The self-consciousness issues don't end there. He's gotten a tad pudgy in recent years, and he doesn't find it flattering. Much like his (lack of) love life troubles, he completely avoids the issue.

(Oh, here's a couple of fun facts: Those who know him consider Joel to be rather "dad-like", both in terms of appearance and demeanor. A few even think his lips look awfully kissable...)

So then. What's in store for him?
111.title: Joel the Arcanine

1111.content:
A fine choice. What better way to help our Arcanine with his body image issues than to turn him into a big, beefy hunk?

Here are a couple starter ideas for you:

Get Pumped, With Some Help
Joel realizes proper dieting and exercise are the only way to lose weight, but he lacks the drive. Thankfully, he comes across a certain someone or something to push him into the latter, and produces far better results than he could ever hope for!

Kisses of Growth
An encounter with a mischievous but well-intentioned Ghost-type results in Joel getting hexed. Now every kiss on the lips causes him to bulk up with a tiny bit of muscle. And it can't just be a coincidence everyone starts acting more affectionate with him...

Do either of these work for you?
1111.title: Joel: Muscle Growth

11111.content:
Low chatter filled the studio apartment. From the kitchen island where a certain Arcanine loomed, Joel laid out an assortment of snacks on the counter. Pizza logs with clumps of pepperoni dribbling out the side. Sushi rolls cut into bite-sized circles. Cocktail shrimp, like little pink thumbs, plunged headfirst into a crimson sauce.

Joel himself watched as his friends gathered around the television. Small crowds on the screen cheered as the parade of lovingly crafted pokemon floats maneuvered through the familiar main-street haunts.

“Hey Joe, there’s Game Corner,” Harry, a wild Rattata said. He bounced on the balls of his feet as the camera panned past the carefully painted art of trading card characters in festive gear and the words Happy New Year in jubilant red font.

Joel chuckled. He took a beer from the fridge and popped the top with a bottle opener. The bottle cap bounced on the counter as he reached and dropped it into the trash can. His sinuses were rosy with firewater -- the flames in the core of his stomach lapped up the fuel. He stifled a soft burp, then nursed his drink once more.

“Outdid yourself on the glasswork, kid” Joel tilted his bottle at the Rattata. The purple shift manager bowed for the guests, and they applauded generously.

An Umbreon in a white turtleneck sweater sat on a loveseat outside of the partygoers, one leg crossed over the other. Joel took a plate of appetizers and made his way for the Umbreon.

“You’re awfully quiet,” Joel presented the umberon a beer.

The Umberon waved them off politely, then smiled, “I’m content here.”

Joel pulled up a stool and sat beside the Umbreon, the arcanine pushed his glasses up his muzzle and cleared his throat. “Uh, thanks for showing up. I know you’re not one for parties and all…”

“No need to apologize,” the Umbreon, one Edgar Gray, uncrossed his legs and he sat with his hands in his lap. “Though I’m not looking forward to driving home with all the drunkards that’s for sure.”

“I’ve got space here; I wouldn’t let you do that if you’re uncomfortable,” Joel snorted, and he took a mouthful of beer, “you’re always welcome, you know that.”

“Haven’t changed a bit, have you?”

Joel beamed, and he looked over at the television. The countdown was on the horizon. A massive papier-mache Master Ball dangled above town square with spotlights on its blue ‘chassis.’

“I do love how a smaller city celebrates; it feels more...personal.”

“Celadon’s a nice place once you get over the fact that the locals all know each other, took me years to start fitting in,” Joel picked his teeth.

The television lit up with activity as the others in the room began to countdown. Five, four, three, two, one-- Happy New Year!

The master ball popped open as a deluge of confetti scattered the ground like technicolor snow.

Joel hooted and chuckled, “happy new year Ed.” He playfully punched the Umbreon's shoulder.

Edgar wore his ever polite smile and rubbed his sore arm.

The Rattata hooped and hollered as a firework finale illuminated the windows. All eyes were peeled from the TV to watch the garden of sound and light erupt in the sky. The colors flashed in familiar shapes -- the head of Rayquaza in brilliant celadon green peppered with oxidized crimsons.

“Your young protege is certainly an excitable one,” Edgar mumbled.

“Who? Harry?” Joel took his glasses from his muzzle and cleaned them on his shirt. “Ah, he’s a good kid. Don’t let him anywhere near sugar though. I think his parents deprived him of it when he was younger.”

As the party died down, Harry moved through the bright crowded room and found Joel beside Edgar. Harry raised his bottle and smiled -- his buck teeth glistened in the fluorescent light. “Happy New Year Bossman.”

“Harry you know you can just call me Joe outside of work, right?”

“Got it, boss,” Harry slumped in the loveseat beside Edgar.

Joel rolled his eyes, but tipped his bottle toward Harry all the same, “happy new year, Harry.”

“Isn’t he a little young to be drinking?” Edgar quirked his brow.

“Dude, I’m twenty-three,” Harry sputtered, and he held up two fingers and then three in rapid succession.

“Oh so you’re a la--”

“Ed,” Joel grunted and shook his head.

“A late bloomer?” Harry’s ears fell some.

“It’s not that big of a deal,” Joel shook his head, “I was a Growlithe into my twenties, but look at me now.”

Harry snorted, “right boss. So…” Harry cocked his head, “you guys got any resolutions for the new year?”

Edgar shrugged, “stay home more, read more books.”

“You do plenty of that, Ed,” Joel chided.

“Then I’m on the right track,” Edgar examined his clawed fingers, “what about you, big guy?’

Big guy. Joel winced and patted his paunch. “Er, I’m a tad old for resolutions.”

“Come on boss. There’s always room for resolutions. We don’t ever stop getting better, right?’

“Well, I could always stand to lose some weight,” Joel shrugged, “or maybe put on the right kind of weight.” He flexed a flabby bicep and chuckled.

“You know what boss, I’m on the same page,” Harry bounced a little in his seat, “see I’ve meant to bulk up on account of the, y’know, but it’s not easy for me to put on weight. Any weight, I mean. But I met this guy, and he’s been really helping me out. I put on a whole two pounds in a few weeks. ”

“Kinda wish I had that same problem,” Joel rolled his eyes.

“Yeah, but you know you could bulk up pretty crazy I bet. I read up that guys who put on weight easy get muscle just as quick.”

Edgar slumped back in his seat, “yes, but you’re talking to the king of excuses here.”

Joel shrugged, “between the store and home stuff I don’t have time for the gym.”

“Aw c’mon boss, I bet if we worked together and kept each other accountable and all, we could get it done,” Harry said with his dewy eyes.

Joel rubbed his temples, “alright, fine kid. I’ll see this guy you’re going on about.”

“My oh my,” Edgar quirked a brow, “maybe you have changed some.”

“Hardy har,” Joel scoffed, “now before this whole gym talk kills my appetite, I’m getting another pizza log.”

--
Early that next morning, Joel tottered into the kitchen. His glasses slightly askew and a horrible headache embedded deep in his skull. He watched the coffeepot come to a boil as his furry paunch peeked beneath his undershirt. He sighed and tucked his gut away.

Over the kitchen-island, he saw Edgar asleep on the couch. The Umbreon curled up in a cozy bundle of blankets with his head propped atop a spare pillow Joel kept for guests. Joel smiled, almost like old times, much as Edgar pushed his buttons he was glad to see the Umbreon back in his life even if it could only be for a few days.

Joel gasped as his cell-phone buzzed to life. He fumbled with the lock screen and put it to his head.

“M’ello?” He grunted.

“Hey, boss!” said Harry.

Joel leaned over the counter and rubbed his eyes.

“It’s New Years’ day, Harry; I don’t think that the gym is open.”

“I’m here right now! The owner says he’d be glad to meet you.”

“Does it have to be today?”

“C’mon boss, you said you were serious.”

Joel scratched his gut, sighed, and nodded, “fine. I’ll be there in an hour…” Joel hung up the phone and hobbled back to his room. His stiff legs barely obeyed.

-----

The Bodybuilder:
Shed the winter weight and rock the beach-bod -- Joel’s new fitness instructor is a Machamp with a passion for bodybuilding. Six-packs, bowling ball biceps, and glutes that can kill with a flex. Symmetry and balanced bulking are in this regiment. Will Joel be able to keep up?

The Musclebeast:
Bigger is better, but the biggest is best -- Joel’s new fitness instructor is a Nidoking obsessed with gains. Roidguts, meaty slabs for arms, and pecs big enough for their own area code. Growth is all that matters in this regiment, chemically induced or otherwise. Will Joel be able to tame his inner muclebeast?

The Strongmon:
It doesn’t look pretty, but who cares when you can haul a freight train? -- Joel’s new fitness instructor is a Hariyama most concerned with power. Muscleguts, bear hugger arms, and tire thick necks. Strength is the purest virtue, despite all the dirty bulking. Will Joel’s self-esteem cope despite getting even heavier?
11111.title: Resolutions

111112.content:
Celadon Gym was always a bit too out of the way for Joel's liking. That's what he always told folks, anyway.

To be fair, he did genuinely feel that way. It was just, when paired with all his other reasons for never exercising, it tended to come off as an excuse. Which it was.

Why was it holed up in an isolated part of southwestern Celadon anyhow? Joel had asked his employees that before and gotten several different answers. One said it was because the gym leader favored quieter places. Another claimed it was a drug front. Someone joked that it's a gym rat containment zone.

Basically, nobody knew.

"Not like I'm here to find out," Joel muttered to himself as he pulled into a parking spot close to the building. He observed the lot; mostly empty, unsurprisingly. A familiar purple and cream figure stood at the entrance. He grinned.

Stepping out of the car, he waved at Harry, who enthusiastically waved back and ran up to him.

"Mornin', boss!"

"Morning, Harry."

Joel began walking to the entrance, Harry falling in step with him. "So who am I looking for here?"

Harry waved a hand. "Oh, don't worry. You'll know him when you see him."

What a helpful description.

Biting back a sarcastic remark, Joel let Harry take the lead.

The automatic doors of the entrance's glass wall opened and they stepped into a surprisingly quaint lobby. Well, surprising to Joel. The last gym he'd ever been to was the one at his college, and that was part of an educational building.

As Harry went over to the receptionist, Joel took everything in. The reception area was the typical white tiling associated with that modern "professional" kind of look he never cared for, but it gave way to a dark wood panel flooring that covered the rest of the room. On the opposite end was a large double door labeled "stadium." The other to two walls each had two similar entrances, with one on each side labeled with plaques he couldn't quite make out; the locker rooms, most likely. Of particular note were the various potted plants in the corners and on the desk. He couldn't identify any of them (not one for plants) but they certainly looked more exotic and less plastic than one would expect from your average lobby. One of the desk plants even sported an assortment of red, blue, and purple flowers.

Harry, evidently done talking with the Pidgeot receptionist, turned to Joel and pointed his thumb at the double doors on the left. "Payton's right through there. He doesn't like it when you interrupt his workout, so we'll have to wait a bit if we catch him during a set."

"Gotcha." Joel followed Harry through the closer double doors. The transition from wood paneling to softer gym tiles was jarring enough, but the plethora of gym equipment made him feel like he'd entered a new building altogether.

But before he could take it all in, a deep grunt caught his attention. Harry motioned to follow. They passed a row of bench presses when Joel stopped dead in his tracks.

Was...was that a person?

A massive, purple beast with a gray torso worked away at a plate-loaded weight machine, grunting and huffing with each rep.

Joel's mind raced. What was this thing? Who let it in here? Why was it using the equipment? And why was Harry just smiling and nodding to himself as he watched?

Then he thought: Oh. That's Payton.

Of course. That wasn't some creature, that was a Nidoking. A big Nidoking. Huge, even. Also the buffest man Joel had ever seen. He would've made a comment under his breath, but Harry's warning had him worried even the tiniest noise would--

No, no, none of that. This Payton fellow may be a real monster of a 'mon, but that was no reason to think of him as some feral beast.

Still, no one could deny his intimidating size. Those arms, for example. Biceps like bowling balls, forearms nearly the size of Joel's waist (which was not slim, mind you!), boulder shoulders, and hands big enough to crush a man's skull... And those veins! They bulged and throbbed, decorated so much of his arms. His traps threatened to swallow up his neck; turning his head must be difficult. Then came the torso. By Arceus, each individual pec had to be bigger than his head! And they jutted out so far, straining a white tank top that failed to cover a mighty roidgut. Below that, pillar-like legs tested the limits of black spandex shorts that stopped a third of the way down the thighs.

The plates clanged one last time as Payton let his arms fall to his sides. Drenched in sweat, he grabbed a towel laying at his side and wiped his face dry. He then dropped the towel and caught his breath for a moment before turning to his two-man audience, briefly eying Joel before focusing on Harry.

"Mornin', Harry!" he said with a grin. Damn, that's a deep baritone.

"Mornin', coach!" Harry replied. "Happy New Year!"

"Same to you!" Payton turned back to Joel. "I take it he's the guy you told me about?"

"Yup!" Harry gestured toward Joel. "Meet my boss, Joel!"

Payton slowly got up. He had to at that size. Honestly, it was a wonder he could even move at all. He didn't even have to try to emphasize his unfathomable musculature; it just happened naturally. "So you're him, eh? Harry's told me a lot about you."

Joel gawked for another moment then forced himself to focus. "Some of it good, I hope." That didn't sound too freaked out or anything, did it?

Thankfully, the joke hit its intended mark, eliciting a laugh from Payton. "Nothing but!" He extended a hand. "Nice to finally meet the man himself."

Cautiously, Joel accepted the hand, gripping and shaking it as firmly as he could. Hopefully Payton could feel that. "Nice to meet you too."

Payton seemed about to ask something when Harry darted over to Payton's pile of things by the weight machine and handed him a water bottle. "Ah, thanks," he said before taking a swig.

Joel couldn't help but smile. "Kid has a knack for getting in tune with others, doesn't he?"

"That he does, that he does."

The two older men beamed at Harry, whom turned bashful, clasping his hands behind his back. "Yeah well..." He sheepishly kicked at the floor. "Just doing what I can."

Payton nodded. (Was that difficult for him?) "Speaking of which-" he turned to Joel "-he mentioned you might be interested in my services."

"Well..." Joel's gaze fell to his paunch.

"C'mon boss!" Harry interjected. "You told me you'd like to 'put on the right kind of weight.' And Payton's just the guy to help you do it!"

"Sure am!" Payton stuck out his chest. So huge... "I didn't start off like this, y'know. Truth be told, I was about your size when I started, gut 'n all."

Joel stared in something akin to wonder. "Did you now..."

"Yup. It'd take some doing, but I promise if you take up my program and really stick with it, you'll get...close to my size."

One side of Joel's mouth curled upward. "Just close?"

"I like being the biggest guy in the room."

"Fair enough." He thought for a moment. "What exactly does your program entail of? I doubt anyone can get gains like yours just by working out."

"You'd be taking a lotta stuff. Pills, supplements, lots of protein powder, that sorta thing. It's also more about size than anything."

Joel looked past Payton--a tad difficult, considering--and noticed a pin inserted a little less than a third of the way down the weight stack. "Huh" was all he could say.

Gains beyond belief, but he wouldn't be as strong as he looked...

He shrugged. "Well, strength isn't much of a concern for me... I guess I--"

Payton held up a hand. "Just take a week to think it over. I'll give you my number and if you're up for it, gimme a call and we'll work something out."

Joel felt like breathing a sigh of relief. "Okay, great. Thanks."

"Perfect." Payton went to collect his things. "Well, if that's everything, I better hit the showers. Harry, come help me with my back, will ya?"

----------

Seed Sown:
Joel just can't get Payton out of his mind. To think that such a size was possible... And he could even achieve it! Well, maybe. First he has to make that call.

Apprehension:
Absurd sizes? Taking supplements? Is this Payton guy's program really such a good idea? Not sure what to think, Joel sticks around a little longer. Seeing how Harry gets along with the guy might help him decide.

On the Back Burner:
No need to mull it over right now; he can call Payton whenever. Besides, it's New Year's! Today's a day to rest, relax, and spend time with others. And with Edgar in town, the two of them can finally catch up.
111112.title: The Musclebeast

1111123.content:
Joel eased the door shut behind him. His keys jangled as he lumbered across the apartment to his kitchen island. He dropped a pile of envelopes on the bar, then hung his keys on a small sudowoodo statuette.

Low jazz fusion music played, with its rapid jumps up discordant scales, and the drums a backbeat hip-hop jam. Edgar sat on the couch, cocooned in his blanket. He bobbed his head to the music as he thumbed through the virtual pages on his tablet.

"How'd it go?" Edgar said.

Joel sighed, he sorted out the mail he neglected throughout the week. He tossed credit card apps into an ashtray and flicked embers at them until they turned to black ash. "Went pretty well, the guy in charge was pretty nice but Ed," Joel chuckled, "you shoulda seen him. He was huge."

"Like Theodore Clark huge?" Edgar looked up from his tablet.

"Take Ted and, like, fuse him with his long lost twin, and you've got a Nidoking look-a-like."

Edgar whistled, "and he's supposed to be training you?"

"Well," Joel rubbed the back of his neck, "I haven't exactly signed up yet."

Edgar scoffed, he looked down at his tablet again, his pointed ears swiveled, "too intimidated?"

Joel slumped in the couch beside the Umbreon. Joel sniffed. "A little, yeah," Joel pushed his glasses up his muzzle, "besides that, I wanted to get home before you left."

Edgar said nothing, but Joel saw the slightest of twitch in Edgar's lips.

"Thought maybe I could convince you to stay a bit longer," Joel shrugged, "treat you to some Celadon hospitality before you disappeared again. After all, you didn't say goodbye last time."

Edgar sighed. He laid his tablet on his chest, and he faced Joel. The Arcanine wore a puppy dog pout, his moist blue eyes glistened behind his square spectacles. He punctuated the well-rehearsed expression with a small whine. The desperate cherry atop this pitiable sundae.

"And here I thought you'd be too old to do that," Edgar grumbled.

"Does that mean you'll stay a bit longer?"

"Fine, fine, you incorrigible canine."

Joel's brow raised, and his maw hung loose in a dog smile.

"I can't stay another night, I've got hotel reservations I need to make good on," Edgar raised his index finger.

"At least let me treat you to lunch," Joel reached over and squeezed Edgar's shoulder, "I know just the place."

---

The Village Green wasn't especially busy that cold January afternoon. The streets beyond the canvas windows were empty of cars. Only the occasional 'mon braved the sidewalk in search of open establishments. Joel and Edgar entered the restaurant side by side.

"See, hardly anyone here, perfect right?" Joel whispered to Edgar.

Edgar nodded once, his hands tucked into his coat pockets.

"Ah Mister Vesta," a Furret host said, adjusting his bowtie as he took notice of Joel, "how might I help you this fine afternoon?"

"Just a table for two, Pas," Joel held two fingers up and patted Edgar's back.

"For two? Back in the dating scene, eh?" Pasquale took two menus from his desk, and he beckoned Joel and Edgar follow.

Edgar's ears straightened. Joel cleared his throat.

"Er, Ed's an old friend of mine who came to visit, figured I'd give him a good time before he left."

Joel took his favorite seat near the back, where the warm Altomarian food smells wafted from the kitchen doors. A smooth clarinet tune played from hidden speakers.

"Might I start you off with something to drink?"

"A bottle of Pietrabianca please," Joel nodded.

Pasquale gave a curt bow and left for wineracks.

Edgar shuffled uneasily in his seat, "so people here, they know you're..."

"Bi? It's not a bad word outside of Saffron, y'know?" Joel eyeballed his menu. His heart was already set on the 'Fruit of the Sea and Pasta.'

"Have to admit, it's hard to imagine you with an active dating life."

"One, ouch," Joel mocked a wince, "and two, it was only a couple dates," he loosed a sad sigh, "but as you can tell I wasn't all that successful."

"I didn't mean to salt the wound," Edgar offered a slight smile to reassure the Arcanine.

"You still with that guy, what's his face," Joel scratched his chin, "Chet? Chad?"

"Chester," Edgar rolled his eyes.

"Yeah, that's it. Knew it was one of those teen-movie bully names," Joel giggled.

"You're an ass," Edgar fought a smile.

"But yeah, you still seeing him?"

"We're..." Edgar's smile faltered, "we're giving each other space."

The wine arrived in the knick of time. Joel poured a glass and ordered his food in a pinch. Edgar mumbled "Chicken Parmesan," and he sized up the white wine like a fox to a hen.

Joel poured a generous glass for Edgar and took a sip from his own. He smacked his lips.

"How much space?"

Edgar swirled his wine. He nursed a healthy swallow. His ears flattened, "how much space is between Palette Town and Saffron?"

"Oh," Joel pushed his glasses up his muzzle, his nostrils flared, "so this road trip isn't really just a short visit to your folks' place is it?"

Edgar went to sip his glass and found it nearly empty.

"Are your folks still..." Joel cranked his wrist.

Edgar poured himself another glass, "you know my mom called me 'the prodigal son?' In that sour 'I-told-you-so' voice she's got."

"Okay, that answers my question."

"But I don't have anywhere else to go," Edgar rubbed his eyes.

Joel drummed his claws on the table, "well, there's room at my place."

"Joel, no."

"Only for now. I promise you'll have your own space, you don't have to pay any rent or food. I'll even let you pick up hours at the Game Center when you're ready for that sort of thing."

"I said no." Edgar's eyes watered. He poured another glass. The silence was thick between the two.

"And dinner is served!" Pasquale laid out the plates with gusto. Joel thanked the Furret as he returned walked away.

Joel prodded the buttered shrimp and scallops, and he whimpered.

"You're incredibly sweet J, always have been," Edgar said softly. He invoked the nickname! Joel's tail sagged, he had wondered if he would ever hear it again.

Edgar bowed his head, "I almost hate you for it."

Joel winced, for real this time.

"When I see you, with that dumb smile, with your friends and your home and your career, how happy you are, how different you are, I'm almost fooled into trying again."

The wine was talking now, but at least it spoke openly.

Joel sighed, he took Edgar's hand and clasped it in both of his meaty paws, "I'm not asking that we try again. I'm offering you a safe place to stay. The fact that you're around again, well, that's a happy bonus."

-----
Warmer
Edgar is still guarded but agrees to stay if Joel keeps his distance. The past refuses to stay in the past, but part of Edgar is open to change.

Wildfire
Edgar's guard is down, he desperately wants to believe things are different. Maybe it's the wine or the rebound from a bad relationship talking, Edgar chooses a more intimate agreement. Under one condition...

Extinguished
Edgar doesn't believe Joel's changed enough. Heartbreaking as it is, he can't open himself back up again. He leaves and Joel is left to contemplate what's been lost and where he ought to go from there.
1111123.title: On the Back Burner

11111232.content:
Edgar's breath was hot on Joel's lips. The soft aroma of white wine lingered on the kiss. Joel's fingers glided across the Umbreon's cheek. Their lips touched again, the heat in Joel's core spread to his limbs.

They stood in Joel's living room, locked in an embrace. Their clothes piled on the floor beside the couch. Joel's briefs hugged tight to his pudgy hips -- his tell-tale erection pitched the fabric upward, and it brushed against Edgar's stomach.

Edgar gasped, his shoulders trembled as Joel pulled him closer. The Umbreon laid his head against Joel's chest. He loosed a shaky whimper.

Joel stopped, he loosed his grip, "you alright?"

Edgar's chest rose and fell.

"Hey, we don't have to do anything if you're not feeling it," Joel ran his hand through Edgar's ears and down the back of his neck.

Edgar hooked his thumbs around Joel's briefs.

Joel stood still as he let Edgar make the next move. A wave of pleasure crawled up Joel's spine as his penis bounced free. The plain white briefs slunk down his doughy thighs and to his ankles.

Edgar kissed Joel's neck, and Edgar pushed Joel to the couch.

The Arcanine lay supine, his body aching and throbbing.

The Umbreon slid off his own underwear, and he straddled Joel cautiously. Though on top and in control, he still seemed anxious. He felt small on the larger-than-usual Arcanine.

Joel rubbed Edgar's flat stomach, "I missed you, Ed." Joel grabbed Edgar's hands and squeezed them. A smile, full and brimming with warmth, lit up Joel's cheeks. There was a kindled flame once absent from Joel's eyes.

Edgar's nerves scattered -- he was safe here. Edgar took Joel into himself and lowered his hips. The Umbreon's penis flexed as it grazed against Joel's gut.

Joel moaned, his jaw stretched open and locked. He reached out, and he stroked Edgar's length -- his thick paws wrapped tight around Edgar. Edgar whimpered, and his eyes clenched tight.

The world and its worries disappeared. Only Joel and Edgar remained. Their bodies rocked to and from each other. Faster and faster. They lasted no longer than a minute, their bodies so starved for intimacy and touch.

Edgar seized, a white streak jettisoned between Joel's fingers and across his belly. Joel came next. His legs and his testicles spasmed as he filled Edgar further.

They gasped for breath as Edgar slumped flat on Joel's soft chest. The long orgasm lulled them from stupor to sleep.

---

Joel's eyes cracked open. Edgar lay in Joel's arms, he took pawfuls of Joel's chest fur. Darkness enveloped them, the faint glow of Joel's cellphone cued the time.

"Staying doesn't sound so bad anymore," Edgar yawned. How long had he been awake?

"But?" Joel croaked, he licked his dry lips.

"There's this nagging doubt..."

"What can I do to prove that I can make this work?"

"No more excuses Joel, no more hiding when things get hard."

"Okay, okay, no excuses."

"So when I ask you if you're signing up for that gym?"

"I...I'm signing up tomorrow." Joel sighed.

"Thank you," Edgar nuzzled Joel's neck, "the longer you keep to that mindset, the longer I stay."

Joel's thoughts faded. He hugged Edgar tighter. His addled mind wondered where dreams and reality began.

---
Bon-Bon Bulking
Joel signs up for Payton's gym but discovers that the secret to Payton's size is built on a performance-enhancing drug: Rare Candy. Sure there are side-effects -- intense mood swings, increased appetite, losing control of one's pokemon abilities, addiction -- but the pros just might outweigh the cons.

Pain and Gain
Turns out a lifestyle change is a miserable undertaking, but at least it won't come with weird side effects. Payton respectfully abides Joel's decision to bulk naturally and shows him the ropes. The first week is honest workouts, bulking on protein and supplements. The results are slower, but cleaner. Unfortunately, Harry's taken a serious liking to Payton's secret regiment.
11111232.title: Wildfire

111113.content:
Joel sipped his coffee as he drove the near-empty streets of down town Celadon. Everyone else was where he should have been -- nursing their hangovers and spending time with loved ones. Yet here he was scouring the streets for an address that he hardly remembered.

Joel glanced around at an intersection, drove through, and he saw the remains of the previous evening’s festivities. The local shops were still adorned in their New Years decorations. With streamers and shiny ribbon dangling from second story windows and the Rayquaza statue at the local “Celadon Community Center” dressed in evergreen garlands.

Further along Mainstreet, Joel neared his own business: Game Corner. Beside his humble establishment was the two-story bakery: Goldenkrisp. A smiling Kanghaskhan adorned the signage. On the front porch, shoveling snow was a young Kanghaskhan, no older than twelve, with her adoptive cubone brother.

The Kanghaskhan looked up from her shovel and waved, eyes pearly and alight. Her cubone bronter clutched his snow shovel to his chest -- the impliment utterly alien in his palms.

Joel rolled down the windows and he pulled beside the bakery, “your mom’s already got you two working, RB?”

RB nodded, “I think she thinks vacation’s a bad word or something.”

“Or she looked it up in the wrong dictionary,” Joel pushed his glasses up his muzzle, “hey Ridge.”

The Cubone nodded attentively but said nothing.

“What are you doing down here if your nerd store’s closed?”

“Mister Harry wanted to meet me and I happened to be in the neighborhood --”

The front door creaked open and a positively massive Kanghaskhan stood in the doorway. Her broad frame cast a horned shadow on the snow. . Her face creased with stern age lines born of the hard Wild’s lifestyle. Draped across her chest as an apron woven with traditional Altan tribe symbols. She saw Joel and smiled.

“Joel!”

“Mornin’ Sarnai,” Joel waved, “sorry to bother the kids, but you know me, I can’t not say hi.”

“Pah you know better than to apologize, always nice to see you neighbor, ” Sarnai said and she sprinkled her mumbling with her native tongue, “What brings you to work, is your store not closed today?”

“Oh like I was just about to tell the kids, I’m meeting a friend somewhere down here and figured I’d say hello.”

A ringing bell set the Arcanine’s ears erect.

“Oh, oh,” RB shuffled toward her mother, “mama, the cookies.”

Sarnai gasped and bolted inside. Joel’s brow quirked and she returned a moment later. Warm smells wafted through door and sliced through the blustery winter world beyond. In her arms was a blue pastry box. An assortment of chocolate chip cookies teased a growl from the Arcanine’s belly. He hadn't eaten that morning, foolish as he was.

“Oh thanks but I really can’t dip into your profits--”

“So humble but I was waiting to give these to your tomorrow anyhow. I owe you after your help with this past Festival Eve."."

“Well Sarnai, I am grateful and I would gladly take them, but I’m sort of starting this diet and--”

“But they are the special ones made with Aspear berry sauce.”

“Aspear berry…” the Arcanine grunted, “okay maybe I can take those off your hands.”

“Wonderful!” Sarnai took the box to Joel and fed it through the passenger window of his car. The box of cookies filled the confined space with the tart yet chocolaty scent that contributed to his growing waistline over the years. Joel forced a smile as she stepped back from the window.

“Well, maybe I’d best get going, don’t want to keep Harry waiting.”

“Oof, Arceus no, he will come to pieces if he has to wait,” Sarnai chuckled, “perhaps you could stop by later. If you don’t have any other plans?”

“I’ll think about it, got a busy day ahead.”

“Well, you know how to reach me.”

“Of course. Happy New Year guys, and take care,” Joel rolled up the window and drove off. Baked temptation seated beside him. Already his New Years Resolution was dissolving as the Aspear berry scent burrowed through his will.
111113.title: The Strongmon

1111131.content:
Joel reached toward the box but paused as he saw a familiar purple figure pacing the snowy sidewalks. At his side was a barefaced building with a "Masura's Gym" sticker on the front window.

Joel grabbed the box and took it from the passenger seat and hid it on the floor. He grunted as his seatbelt dug into his gut while he forced himself upright. The Arcanine cleared his throat and and smiled once Harry noticed him.

“You’re sure you gave me the right place?” Joel said as he rolled down the window

“Yeah it’s brand, brand new,” Harry rubbed his hands together and fought back shivers He sniffed the air briefly. “Boss, are those cookies I smell?”

“Seasonal air freshener,” Joel bit the inside of his cheek as he rolled up the window. He powered down the car and lumbered around the front of the vehicle.

“Alright kid, let’s get this over with.”

Through the glass doors they found themselves in a barren lobby. A desk was set tucked against a corner beside some filing cabinets.

“Come on Boss, this way,” Harry removed his coat as the central heat washed over him.

Joel welcomed the extra warmth to his internal flame. The fire rushing through his system relaxed and a wave of relaxation washed over him. Beyond a narrow entryway they found a massive open room.

Plastic lined the floor where workout equipment was being assembled. Benches, power racks, barbell stands. And for some reason a monster truck tire smack dab in the middle of the room.

On one of the completed benches sat asf lay a Hariyama. The stout pokemon grunted as he benched what Joel realized was eight hundred pounds.

A beefy Charizard with a bulging gut and rippling biceps stood behind as spotter. His clawed fingers trembled as he watched the master at work - as if fearful he might not be able to properly spot at this weight.

The Hariyama gasped as he finished his set. He reracked the barbell, then rocked himself to a sitting position. His rolling mass of belly spilled over the front of his workout shorts. The Hariyama clapped his hands of sweat and fought to catch his breath. He swung his legs around the bench and looked over at Harry and Joel.

Panting, he gave them a curt wave, then motioned for them to come closer.

“Mornin’ er…” the Hariyamaa snapped his fingers.

“Harry,” the Charizard said.

“Right,” The Hariama said, “it’s been a haze of new faces, I don’t mean any disrespect.”

“None taken master Masaru,” Harry bowed and remained that way.

The two bulky pokemon across Harry stared nonplussed. Joel cleared his throat.

“The name’s Joel Shao.” he extended his paw to shake.

Masaru took his hand and shook it once, “ah, I thought I recognized you. You own one of those stores along Main-Street, is that correct?”

Joel smirked, but could barely mask his bewilderment, “er, yes. How’d you know?”

“Saw your picture on TV the other night, some card game thing --”

"Oh the Cardcanum for Charity tournament,” Joel chuckled, “yeah we had a bunch of locals hold a tournament and people donated money to the Pokemon Center.”

“In any case, it’s humbling to have such a well-liked Celadon citizen enter my establishment.” Masura crossed his arms. “Name’s Akebono Masura, and this here is my business partner Aiden.

“Hullo,” the Charizard waved.

“Pleasure’s all mine really,” Joel held up a palm, he never really considered himself a pillar of the community but it was nice to be noticed, “because I think you can help me out.”

“What can I do for you?”

“Well, I’m not getting any younger and, uh, I sorta want to get into a shape other than ‘round,’ Harry tells me that you run a pretty impressive program.”

Masura stroked his chin, “it’s not an easy one, and it doesn’t come cheap.”

“Guess you get what you pay for,” Joel tapped his foot and looked toward Harry, “the gentlerat here, he didn’t mention anything about me spotting his tab did he?”

“He did mention striking a sort of deal,” Masura and Aiden both turned to face harry.

The Rattata shrunk into himself, a bashful smile on his lips. He gulped. “Well, y’see, I had this idea. So, you’re a new business in town, you need some advertising, and I want,” Harry cleared his throat and put his arm around Joel, “we want to reach beefcake status like you two.”

Masura’s wrecking ball biceps and bulging pecs certainly interested Joel. The heavy coat of prodigious belly fat and softness stacked atop the muscle slabs, however…

“I was thinking we could do a cross-promotion thing,” Harry put his hands behind his back, “Joel and I, we do this fitness challenge. Do monthly or weekly progress pictures. Show off your work. We advertise it all over our store. People enamored by our transformation flock to your gym. Everybody wins.”

“Alright, I think I like where this is going,” Masura stroked his chin and paced, “then perhaps I could get you two on the premium circuit. Show off the best I have to offer.”

“Yes!” Harry jumped but immediately retracted. “ I mean, yes, that would expedite things What d’you think boss?”

Joel sighed. Wasn’t this new years thing about losing weight? Joel flexed his fingers and imagined himself deadlifting half a ton. So what's a little extra belly fat? Joel nodded slowly, “I think we could make that work.”

“Then you’ve got yourself a deal.”

--

Joel and Harry stepped back into the snowy streets. The shivering Rattata inched closer toward the heat radiating from his Arcanine boss.

“Y-y’know, it’s gotta be nice b-being your own space heater,” Harry sniffled.

“It has its perks,” Joel bit his bottom lip, “are you going to be alright?”

“I-I’m feeling so much b-b-better now that we landed that deal.”

“Next time try to include me in the initial negotiations,” Joel said. He looked up and down his shivering shift manager, “did you walk here?”

Harry nodded rapidly. His whiskers bounced with his ears.

Joel shook his head, “you could’ve asked me for a ride.”

“W-was too excited to wait.”

Joel looked back at his parked car. He loosed a long sigh, then turned back to the Rattata. “Come on, let’s get you home.”

Harry darted to the car, threw open the door, and nearly stepped on the box of cookies.

“Boss…”

“What?” Joel threw up his hands. “You saw those guys in there; you think they got that way cutting carbs?”

Harry sniffled, “fair point,” he moved the box to the back seat and huddled up on the passenger side. With the engine ignited, the Rattata sighed happily as warm air enveloped him.

A short way down the road, Joel pressed the brakes as a stoplight flickered red.

“Hey, boss?”

“Yeah?”

“Can I have a cookie?”

-----

The stage is nearly set, but there’s one more choice to make -- who gets to be ‘more than friends?’

Rekindling:
Joel decides to eschew meeting with anyone else that day in favor of spending the afternoon alone with Edgar. It’s been years since the struggle of their collegiate youth, and the often unspoken feelings between them. Perhaps there’s room for a braver Joel to finally connect.

Dinner with Family:
Joel takes up Sarnai’s offer to dine with her family. He’s been watching out for them ever since they moved next door to the Game Corner -- sending customers their way, buying the kids gifts when money was tight, and now things might be moving a step further. Joel’s always been ‘fatherly’ anyhow.

Age Brings Experience:
Joel spends the afternoon bonding with Harry over their mutual resolution. Joel’s always seen a lot of himself in Harry -- both late bloomers, outgoing yet insecure about their bodies, and no luck in romantic ventures. Maybe Joel’s always been more than a mentor to his protege.
1111131.title: The Strongmon (Concluded)

choices: Only Way to a Man's Heart
1112.content:
Weight gain, eh? He's already got a bit of a start on that. It won't exactly make him happy, but that's just how it goes sometimes.

Here are a couple potential scenarios that'll make our softie of an Arcanine even softer:

Subliminal Backfire
External factors aside, one of Joel's biggest roadblocks to getting in shape has always been lack of motivation. Then he stumbles upon a subliminal message that promises to push the listener to get bigger. And he does! Just not in the way he wants...

Only Way to a Man's Heart
Joel's dad-like charms must have someone, well, charmed. Why else would someone start leaving anonymous lunches for him at the Game Corner every day? Or maybe they're just being nice. Either way, Joel's not one to turn down free food, even when it finds its way to his waistline.

So, what do you think? Either of these sound fun?
1112.title: Joel: Weight Gain

112.content:
It's a given that male Gardevoir have naturally feminine looks. Most of them just treat said looks as a simple fact of life. Some even take pride in them, though others wish they'd become a Gallade instead. The constant gender confusion doesn't help.

Alex, however, sees his feminine looks as an opportunity for mischief.

He's always been a prankster by nature, and evolving into a Gardevoir's only made him worse. He wears feminine clothes, speaks with a feminine voice, and is even willing to put on makeup on occasion. All for the sake of pulling a fast one on some unsuspecting sap. It's gotten to the point where nobody in his hometown of Oldale trusts him. Even his own parents get wary when he approaches them for anything.

Now that he's attending college in Rustboro City, he can start fresh...in rebuilding his notorious reputation. It certainly helps him that college is an opportune time for messing around, sexual exploration, and making stupid mistakes. So many suckers, so little time...

Is it any wonder Alex doesn't have any friends?

But enough about that. It's time to pick an expansion!
112.title: Alex the Gardevoir

113.content:
After a rather simple and uninteresting eighteen years of life in Violet City, Alec the Typhlosion thought a few years attending Goldenrod University would shake things up a bit.

Two weeks into his second semester, he's finally realized he was expecting too much.

To be fair, it's mostly his fault. Alec isn't part of any sports teams or clubs, doesn't have a job, and has no major interest in exploring the city proper (not anymore). He's made a few acquaintances, but doesn't know them well enough to hang out often. He studies and attends all his classes, sure, but that still leaves him with way too much free time.

On the bright side, his grades are above average. Now if only he could channel that academic competence into an actual major...

On top of all that, he's becoming increasingly frustrated with his lack of a love life. And lack of a sex life, for that matter. He'd do something about it, but he has no idea where to start.

Perhaps spicing up his life with some expansion will do some good. At the very least, it would do his totally average body some good.
113.title: Alec the Typhlosion

1131.content:
Okay! Time to turn our nothing-special Typhlosion into a hunky stud! But how's that gonna happen?

Some starting choices for your consideration:

Natural(?) Growth Spurt
There's no given reason for it. Alec just wakes up one morning to find himself looking a little more muscular. And a little more the next day, and the next day, and...

House of Beefcakes
A new steakhouse has popped up in Goldenrod, seemingly out of nowhere. Feeling curious, Alec decides to check it out and sample their food. Turns out their high-quality beef is better for you than you'd expect!

Do either of these interest you?
1131.title: Alec: Muscle Growth

11311.content:
"Hmm..."

Alec leaned forward, eyes narrowed as he scrutinized his reflection in the bathroom mirror. He looked the same as he always did: average face, middle-of-the-road physique, and a standard height of five foot nine. The textbook definition of a Plain Jane- er, John. Jay? Regardless, his looks were nothing special. Never had been. Just typical Alec, ever unchanging from birth to present day.

And yet something had changed. Overnight, at that.

He rubbed his stomach, frown deepening. Over the course of his first semester at Goldenrod University, his belly had developed an ever so slight amount of padding. It didn't turn into an outright muffin top or anything; just a little outward curve of body fat.

And now it was gone.

But how did that happen? It wasn't like he'd changed his routine or anything. No dietary adjustments, no exercise, hadn't taken any drugs or anything... He never ate with anyone, so it wasn't like there was anyone around to lace his meals with anything either. And even if that were somehow the case, what would they be trying to accomplish by making him lose weight? Malnourishment? Why even do that?

Sighing with frustrated confusion, Alec straightened up and scratched the back of his neck. He certainly didn't consider losing his only sign of the Freshman 15 a bad thing, just a totally weird and out of nowhere thing that made no sense.

And on top of that, something about him just felt different. Everything else about him looked the same as ever, so what gives? He twisted his body this way and that, stretching his arms, even squatting a bit. Something about the way he moved was just...off. In a way he couldn't describe. Alec groaned. His vocabulary failing him just reminded him that his first essay of the semester was due at the end of the week. Why did his body have to start acting weird now? He didn't have time for this.

... Well, actually he did. But still.

Alec thought for a moment. Aside from the stomach thing, his body didn't look different, just felt different. And even then, only when he moved. Maybe--

A knock on the door. "Dude, c'mon! What's the hold-up?!"

Alec winced. Taking one last look at his boxers-clad reflection, he exited the bathroom, muttering an apology to his Pidgeot roommate as he slipped past.

Yeah, he'd have to worry about this later. Even though he could hypothetically use sudden loss of body fat as an excuse to take a sick day, he knew from experience he'd be spending the rest of the semester semester struggling to keep up. Even straight B's took work, after all.

Despite his roommate's impatience, neither of them had to rush; their classes weren't until later in the morning. He could afford to take his time getting dressed, which he did. Though not exactly the tightest clothes, they fit him well enough that he should be able to notice if he'd shrunk anywhere else.

Except he didn't notice any difference. Aside from his stomach, everything fit him the same as always.

Weird.

A few minutes later, he heard a flush followed by the sound of running water. A moment after that his roommate exited the bathroom.

They stared at each other in silence for a moment before Alec felt the need to say something. "Do I look, uh, different at all?" he asked, gesturing to his stomach.

His roommate stared. "Uh, no?" he replied slowly, raising an eyebrow. "Why, do you?"

Alec sighed. Of course the Pidgeot wouldn't notice. They only ever hung out in the dorm room, if being in the same place at the same time could even be considered that. With a shrug, Alec said, "Kinda. My belly fat just...disappeared."

"You have belly fat? Or had, I guess?"

"Yeah."

"Huh." The Pidgeot looked away in thought. Then he just walked over to his side of the bedroom and set to dressing himself.

Alec watched him, waiting for any further response. Nothing. Just awkward silence again. He watched his roommate for a bit longer before giving up and returning his attention to his stomach. Maybe if he stared at it long enough, he could figure out where the fat went...

Wait, no. That's just stupid.

He didn't see much point in worrying. Not yet, at least. He would have to keep a close eye on his body for a while, though, to keep track of any further changes. Then something would definitely be up and he'd have to do something about it. Then again, if it were something that only benefited him like--

His stomach grumbled. Well, regardless of the how and why or what could potentially happen going forward, it shouldn't be too hard to get that fat back. Campus dining wasn't exactly geared towards weight loss, after all. Just one decent breakfast at the cafeteria should get him on the fast track to returning to normal. Not that he wanted to fatten back up, but he didn't care enough to avoid it either. He always had a respectable appetite anyway.

He didn't see much point in worrying. Not yet, at least. He would have to keep a close eye on his body for a while, though, to keep track of any further changes.

------

Regimen-Free Bulking: Only a few days after his belly fat vanished, Alec notices his frame looking a little broader than usual, his clothes fitting just a touch tighter than they should. But it's not fat; there's some firmness that wasn't there before. A little definition too. But why? He's just been going about his normal routine like always. Still, it's hard to complain... (Muscle Growth only)

Hunkification: Like the above option, Alec gains muscle bit by tiny bit each day. But in this case, it's not the only growth he's experiencing. His eye level rises, not by much but just enough for him to notice something off. And not just that, the groin of his pants is tightening, and it isn't just because of his hips or thighs. (Muscle Growth + Height Growth + Cock & Balls Growth)

Best(?) of Both: It's not just muscle Alec gains. While his limbs and pecs show a little more muscle definition by the day, his belly isn't exactly forming a six pack. Quite the opposite, in fact. Whatever is causing him to grow also kicks his appetite into overdrive, resulting in him gaining that little belly back and then some. (Muscle Growth + Weight Gain)
11311.title: Natural(?) Growth Spurt

114.content:
In this particular world of Pokémon, there are two varieties of Legendary. The first is simply a collection of incredibly rare species (Articuno, Entei, etc.)

The second variety, on the other hand, is often spoken of but almost never seen. They're better known as "Mythical Legendaries", and are considered the gods of the world. The higher gods--Arceus and his "offspring", Dialga and Palkia, for example--keep to their own realm and watch over the mortal realm. Any intervention on their part is solely for the sake of maintaining the natural order. Some of the lesser gods--such as the elusive Mew and Celebi--are more or less residents of the mortal realm, but still keep to themselves. They're either free spirits or messengers for the higher gods.

Then there are the ones whose purpose is to directly interact with mortals, like Jirachi.

You know his story: he awakens for one week every millennium to grant wishes. And he hates this arrangement. Every time Jirachi wakes up, he has to learn modern society all over again. (Granted, some things are more or less the same every time, but still...)

But he's not one to linger on his personal woes; too many wishes to grant, and not nearly enough time to handle them all.

Jirachi hates misunderstandings, and every new era seems to bring a new batch of complications that seem to exist for the sole purpose of disrupting proper communication (or maybe it's just him). That's why he takes the time to get acquainted with any mortals seeking out his services.

He wishes he had more time awake, but at least what little he does have is never boring. Especially if any expansion-related wishes are going to be directed at him.
114.title: The Mythical Jirachi

choices: None of these do it, next...
115.content:
All of these gentlemen are leaving you cold? Well, that just won't do; we will bring in more, to see if they rub you the right way...

First off, meet Tod! Just Tod. Tod is kind, and Tod is there for you. He's a relatively young Sawsbuck nurse, who's seen quite a bit of action since he got his job. He's famous across his hospital for his efficiency and bedside manner, and he tends to rank high among employee ranks.

Our other Golden Boy is Charles... though he prefers the name "FlashBack". A feisty and ambitious young jolteon who's trained for professional battling since his elementary years. He's had his sights on the Kanto League all the while, and now he's been taking it on, to prove that he's the very best.

So, will either of these suit your fancy, or are they just a bit too out there?
115.title: Other male options

1153.content:
Those two didn't suit your tastes either, huh? Oh well. Maybe one of these guys will!

If you'd like a feminine-looking guy, try Lee. This self-confident--if just a tad prideful--Milotic has seen some success a cross-dressing model.

Prefer your men on the traditionally masculine side? Consider Harvey, a stocky Venusaur who keeps to himself and makes a modest living through manual labor.

Do either of these two work for you? Yes, no, maybe?
1153.title: More Male Options

11531.content:
As a young boy, Lee couldn't wait to evolve into a Milotic. He hated his frumpy Feebas self, thanks in no small part to all the bullying he endured in school. It didn't help that his parents' good looks gave him a lot to live up to.

Thankfully, puberty came along and blessed him quite nicely. Sleek, vivid scales; a long, graceful tail with a fan of tail fins that put his ratty old one to shame; eyes shining with an allure they never had before; and a sleek, slender body possessing curves a bit more feminine than was expected of males of his species. The small torso was one thing, but he also gained a narrow waist and hips that were just a bit wider than the norm. And he loved it all. He loved stripping down before bed and basking in his newfound beauty. He just couldn't get enough of himself.

Then one night, about a week after evolving, a thought occurred: how good would he look in his mother's dress?

Pretty damn good, it turned out. Better than good, even. Fit him to a T.

Years later, Lee has left his hometown of Fortree City and Hoenn entirely. He now lives in Ecruteak, balancing his day job and his moderately successful career as the online cross-dressing model WaterLiLi. His rise in popularity is a gradual one, but there's no hurry. He's only 27 and he still looks better than ever.

Oh, and don't let his attitude put you off. He's not really egotistical, just...very self-confident. And a tease, if you show him any interest.

Expansion sounds detrimental to him, but who knows. Maybe he can make it work!
11531.title: Lee the Milotic

11532.content:
There's not a whole lot you can say about Harvey. He was born, he grew up, he works hard for a meager living. Not the most riveting life story, not the way he tells it.

His family never had much money. Both his parents had to work long shifts just to cover living expenses, and Harvey himself needed a job of his own just to help pay for his high school education. College was out of the question.

Now, at age 38, Harvey earns his keep as a construction worker in Saffron City. Not exactly the most glamorous job, but someone's gotta do it. He's got the muscle for it, despite his somewhat short height and the body fat he's accumulated over the years.

He doesn't have much of a social life outside of work. Not a lot of opportunities to have one. But that's fine by him. He's introverted enough that he can get by without much social contact. But is that true? Or is he just lying to cover up some loneliness? Who knows...

Sounds like a monotonous life, doesn't it? Let's spruce it up with some expansion!
11532.title: Harvey the Venusaur

choices: Sylvie, the Meowstic who balances stoicism and liveliness
Tanya, the aggressive and proud Staraptor vigilante
Pamela, the sexy and amorous Nidoqueen
12.content:
Alright then!

Our first option is Sylvie, a Meowstic in her last year of high school (or Lycée, if we're to equate Kalos's educational system to France's). Stoic in person, much more lively when texting.

Next is Mae, a Servine botanist looking into a possible link between Grass-types and plants. She's one of those eccentrics who struggles with socialization, but is respectably decent at it all things considered.

There's also Tanya, an aggressive and self-confident Staraptor. She enjoys a good fight, to the point where she takes on common criminals for fun (and praise).

And then there's Pamela. This voluptuous Nidoqueen lives for sexual hedonism, and is more than happy to share some love with just about anyone.

So, what do you think? Any of them to your liking?
12.title: Female Options

121.content:
As expected of her kind, Sylvie is reserved to the point of seeming emotionless. It certainly can seem that way to anyone just meeting her for the first time, but spend enough time with her and you'll start picking up on subtle cues; she might even smile if she likes someone enough. Not too many know her well enough to pick up on them, as she's the type to prefer a small group of friends. An introvert, in other words.

Of course, the stoicism only applies when talking face-to-face. When talking through texts or online, the Meowstic acts far more lively. She's still an introvert, naturally, so she's not likely to start chatting up random strangers on the internet.

One thing she wouldn't admit to anyone outside of her family is her lackluster psychic power. While not terrible, she's just not on the same level as other Meowstic. Even something as basic as bending spoons or levitating takes a bit more effort than she'd like.

But if there's one aspect she's definitely not lacking in, it's her looks. Lovely fur with a good sheen, a slender figure with some gentle curves, and proper care for both ensures at least a few appreciative stares here and there. She doesn't mind them. Heck, she's gone on a few dates. Nobody's struck her fancy yet, though.

Since she's in her last year at Camphrier's high school, her life is due for some change soon. The question is how.
121.title: Sylvie the Meowstic

1211.content:
We have the "who", and we have the "what". That just leaves us with the "how".

Here are your initial choices:

Supplemental Gains
A normal school day takes a turn for the interesting when Sylvie is suddenly offered some strange pills that can enhance her breasts. Who's offering her this stuff? And why?

Expand Your Mind...and Breasts
Meditating is a necessary part of refining one's psychic abilities. Sylvie, having neglected this practice for the longest time, decides to make up for lost time. As you can guess, this leads to her accidentally triggering breast growth.

Do either of these strike your fancy?
1211.title: Sylvie: Breast Expansion

choices: Raina, a friendly Braixen and the principal's daughter.
Beauregard, a Furfrou and one of the only charming flirts.
One of the Science teachers? What for?
12111.content:
As a Meowstic, Sylvie understood the importance of restraint better than some. It was for this reason she didn't join her fellow students in rushing to leave school right after the final bell. Not that she could blame them; they'd spent all day cooped up in class and dinner wasn't too far off.

         Still, midterms were coming. That meant even more studying than usual.

         At least the library was quiet, save for the soft groans of the Illumise sitting across the table from Sylvie.

         "You said it's a mythology paper, right?" Sylvie asked. "Then why not try Sinnoh? I hear they have plenty of myths over there."

         The Illumise, Aurore, grimaced. "We're not learning about Sinnoh right now. Or any of the other regions."

         "You're only covering Kalos?"

         Aurore nodded.

         Sylvie sighed. "So Xerneas, Yveltal, or Zygarde? But that's only three choices. How are you having trouble deciding?"

         "Because everybody's gonna be writing about them. How is my paper supposed to be anything special if we're all covering the same topics?" Aurore slumped forward, resting her chin in her hand. "What does mythology have to do with a Writing Major anyway?"

         "This is a writing project, isn't it?" Sylvie gave her a small smirk. "Besides, it's an exercise in thematic storytelling."

         Aurore just groaned and looked away. "Do you have to be so unhelpful? My grade's kind of important here, you know."

         Sylvie's ears drooped the slightest bit. "I'm not trying to be."

         "I know, I know." Aurore sighed. "Sorry, it's just... I guess I'm just that kind of artist."

         "Desperate to stand out?"

         "Always."

         The two had a short giggle at that. Sylvie took a moment to survey the rest of the library. It was mostly empty, with only the staff doing their jobs and a few of the more diligent students studying. She wasn't going to get much of that done today. Not really a problem, considering she always did well.

         "Still," she said, turning back to Aurore, "it's awfully mean to make you write an essay this close to midterms."

         "No kidding," Aurore replied dryly. "But apparently, Mr. Pyroar disagrees. Jerk."

         Sylvie gave her a sympathetic smile. "Well, knowing you, you'll figure something out just fine. I don't think you've ever gotten anything less than a perfect score on an essay."

         Aurore smiled back. "If you put it that way, I've got nothing to worry about." She stood and picked up her school bag. "I guess I'll just write about all three and talk about life and death or something."

         They said their goodbyes and Aurore left. Sylvie remained seated.

         Their meetup didn't last long, so she could squeeze in a little study time before going home. Then again, she was more interested in finding a book to read. Preferably something short. Or would that still take up too much time?

         Sylvie shook her head. She'd spent enough time at school as is. For now, she just wanted to go home and enjoy a nice dinner with her parents. But before she could even stand up, someone approached her.

choices: "They... The pills respond to your psychic ability."

121111.content:
"Excuse me."

"Hm?"

Sylvie turned to face whomever just spoke only to find herself staring directly at a sizable pair of breasts. The most sizable pair she'd ever seen, in fact. Maybe not downright huge, but certainly a good cup size or two above average. That must be why this mystery busty girl had the top button of her blouse undone, exposing her white-furred cleavage. Or maybe she just wanted to show off.

But that aside, who was this busty girl? And why was she presenting herself to Sylvie in such a way?

A giggle snapped Sylvie out of her thoughts. Her ears twitched. Clearing her throat, she looked up to see the smirking face of a Braixen. She blushed, averted her gaze. "Sorry."

The Braixen giggled again. "Oh, don't be. I wanted you to stare."

Sylvie blinked. Her brow furrowed a tiny bit. "Why?" she asked, daring to face the other girl again but not daring to look anywhere below her chin.

A third giggle, and the leaning Braixen straightened up and walked over to the chair opposite Sylvie. She sat down, rested her head in her hands. Her orange eyes twinkled with amusement and a touch of mischief. "Sooo, how are things?" she asked.

"... Busy."

"Oh, right. Midterms." The Braixen's expression soured for a moment, then brightened right back up. "Buuut anywaaay..." She leaned forward. "I'm glad I finally got a chance to talk to you again, Sylvie! It's been forever!"

Sylvie's eye brows subtly rose. "How do you know my name? Who..." She trailed off.

Suddenly, this girl started looking vaguely familiar. A Braixen with a pretty face and a sunny disposition... Come to think of it, that sounded just like--

"Raina?"

The Braixen girl's-- Raina's smile widened. "You do remember!"

Sylvie nodded. "We were partners for a science project, right?"

"Yup! During our first year."

Sylvie leaned back in her seat, glanced up at the ceiling a moment before looking back at Raina. "That was two years ago. I'm surprised you remember me."

"Of course I remember you!" Raina leaned even further forward. By this point, she was giving Sylvie another good look at her cleavage. "Who wouldn't remember someone so pretty and nice and smart and pretty and, and... Yeah!"

Blushing at the praise, Sylvie found herself struggling to maintain eye contact. "I," she stammered, "er... Thank you." She cleared her throat. "But that all better applies to you."

"Ohh, you think so, do you?" By this point, Raina leaned far enough that she practically laid on the table. She arched her back, thrusting her chest towards Sylvie. "And would these have anything to do with that? Hmmm?"

Sylvie's blush deepened. She tugged at her shirt collar. "I don't remember you being so...flirty."

"Aw c'mon, I'm just teasing!" Raina settled back into her chair. "And so what if I'm being a little flirty? You'd wanna show off too with breasts like these." She cupped them for emphasis.

Despite her best efforts, Sylvie couldn't help sparing a brief glance at them. She flinched at Raina's knowing smirk. "I don't remember you being so well endowed either."

"Well, that's..."

Raina trailed off. She scanned the area, compelling Sylvie to do the same. The library was empty by now, save for the staff members. Turning back to her, Raina said, "Why don't we talk about this on the way home? Here's not a good place."

Sylvie tilted her head in confusion, silently asking Raina for elaboration. When she got none, she nodded and stood. Raina did the same.

------

The sidewalk was sparsely populated as Sylvie and Raina walked alongside each other. Not many folks were out and about so late in the day, especially away from the more tourist-heavy areas. It gave them a sort of semi-privacy.

"Sooo, my breasts," Raina started. "They're a very, um, let's say recent development." With a snicker she added, "If you'll pardon the pun."

"How recent, exactly?" Sylvie asked.

"Just this week. People have been talking about me, of course. Accused me of stuffing my bra, getting work done. That sort of thing."

"So it wasn't because of surgery."

"Of course not!" Raina huffed. "Just 'cause my family's rich doesn't mean I get to spend it on whatever. Mom and Dad would kill me if I got breast surgery."

"Yet they let you enhance them through some other means."

"Well, I had help from someone my parents trust a lot. And it took a lot of convincing. Like, a lot a lot."

Sylvie nodded despite not entirely understanding. The lives of rich folk were nothing but a mystery to her. "And what kind of help did they give you?"

"Developing breast enhancement pills."

The answer came so plainly, as if it were the most ordinary thing in the world. The blase delivery of it nearly made Sylvie wheeze as though it had come along and punched her in the stomach. "Is that so," she said, her disbelief showing through her usually level tone.

Raina forced a laugh, looked away in some random direction. "I guess it does sound pretty crazy, huh?"

Sylvie shook her head. "Have you told anyone else at school about this?"

"Nope. Just you."

"Why just me?"

Raina stopped in place. Sylvie stopped as well and turned to face her.

"Well..." She looked down, interlocked her hands behind her back. "To be honest, I wanted to share them with you."

Sylvie's eyes widened a touch. Words failed her for a good, long moment. The best she could manage was a soft "Me?"

Raina gave a small nod, still not meeting her gaze.

"Why?"

Biting her lip, Raina inhaled deeply and forced herself to make eye contact.

124311.content:
Pamela awoke to a soft, warm embrace. It wrapped around her, caressed her lovely body. And why wouldn't that be the case? Her body, her drop dead gorgeous and sinfully sexy body, lived to be embraced and caressed. Such tantalizing curves were far too good to be display only. Most everyone she'd ever met loved her body, and she always made sure to return that love in kind. Assuming they were up for it.

So why...?

With a sigh, Pamela pulled the covers off, revealing her nude self in all its glory. And nobody else. Again.

Really though, how long had it been since the last time she'd taken anyone to bed? Or, heck, just spent some "quality time" in general? Days? Weeks? Surely it couldn't have been months.

"What day is today?" she muttered as she sat up on the edge of her bed. "Oh right, Saturday. Goody."

Sighing again, she stood up and walked over to her full-length mirror. More accurately, she sashayed over in a manner that would look comically exaggerated if anyone else tried it but perfectly natural with her. Pamela couldn't help but smile. Even in the lousiest of moods, she never failed to appreciate how sexy she was.

Especially when no one else was doing it for her...

Her smile became a frown. Something had to have changed, but what? Couldn't have been her body. A perky pair of breasts bigger than her head, a plump ass of equal size, wide hips, thick thighs, a relatively thin waist, a slight layer of fat all around (which was in no way a negative), soft and supple lips, clear blue eyes that perfectly matched her scales, long eyelashes, a towering height that trumped any man she'd ever met... An eager young man looking for a one night stand, an older woman in need of good stress relief, even a freshly eligible teen learning the ropes would be more stimulating.

Heaving her biggest sigh that morning, she shrugged. "Maybe I'll go for a walk..."

------

The cool morning breeze brushed against Pamela's scales. She inhaled, held for a moment, then exhaled. Maybe it was her mood but Vermilion City's salty air seemed a tad stale to her.

Stale. Just like her sex life.

She shook her head. "No Pam, don't dwell on it. Just go out and have a nice walk and get some breakfast and enjoy yourself. Somehow."

After adjusting her sports bra and jogging shorts (which looked more like booty shorts on her) and double-checking her purse she set off, already set on her destination. A nice breakfast diner was just a few blocks down from her condo complex, making it perfect walking distance.

On her way out of the complex she caught sight of a familiar married couple: Greg, a Raticate, and Mary, a Ninetales. They smiled and waved at her, which Pamela returned in kind.

To think they used to be so bashful around her. Not that she could blame them; a woman of her stature--not to mention the raw sex appeal--had to be intimidating. Although the real bashfulness came from that one time she talked them into a threesome. Not because they didn't enjoy it (they said it was some of the best sex they ever had) but because it forced them to...realize certain things about themselves. Things they needed time to come to terms with. And when they finally did, it didn't take much to persuade them into a round two.

Sadly, round three wasn't looking like much of a possibility. Both Greg and Mary made it abundantly clear they preferred Pamela as just a friend rather than a friend with benefits. Oh well, Pamela would sometimes think, their loss. Only now did she finally realize it was her loss too.

Nothing of note happened during her walk down to the diner. She passed some people on the way. Some of them glanced at her. Some didn't even do that much. What happened to the days she could turn heads just by existing? Looks of disbelief, amazement, envy, lust... Hell, she almost missed the disgust! At least that was something.

The All-Day Breakfast Diner was just that. It had the typical old-school aesthetic and a pretty standard menu, but the food was good and the staff kept the place in good shape. Nothing special on the whole. Still, it did what it needed to and did it well enough for Pamela to stop by regularly. She even used to bring some of her lays here if they spent the night.

Used to.

A set of newspaper vending machines lined the entrance. Pamela gave them a passing glance when one caught her eye. The Kanto Tribune, sporting a full-body shot of a muscular Samurott woman. Smiling, Pamela paid 50 pokédollars and took a copy.

"I can always count on you to brighten up my day, Athena."

And then she took a closer look. Athena lacked her usual confidence. A subtle slouch and an expression that tried to look neutral but possessed a subtle glumness. The headline wasn't much better: "Unova's Top Battler in Slump."

"Geez, you too?" Pamela walked to her usual table, not bothering to look up from the paper. A quick scan of the article revealed Athena couldn't muster up the same passion for League Battling she used to have. Nothing challenged her anymore. Even deliberately putting herself at a disadvantage didn't work. So, she decided to take a hiatus and do a little soul searching.

"Aw, poor thing," Pamela said. Part of her hoped that meant Athena would go on a little vacation. Maybe to, say, Vermilion? It would be a nice chance for them to get acquainted, if it were possible. A walk around the city, some dinner, maybe get her hands on those tantalizing muscles and--

"Fawning over your celebrity crush, miss?"

Pamela looked up to see a Sandshrew waiter grinning at her. "Am I that obvious, Dan?" she replied with a grin of her own.

Dan laughed. "Well, considering who I'm talking to..." He raised a pencil and notepad. "The usual?" Pamela barely nodded before he started jotting down the order.

Was that her problem? Had she become too obvious and predictable to woo anyone? Even Dan, a young man of nineteen years who still got flustered at the tiniest hint of anything sexual, could approach her without any problem.

Then again, they had known each other ever since Dan's friends dared him to have sex with Pamela for his eighteenth birthday.

Which didn't happen, of course. Dan really wasn't interested and Pamela didn't like the idea of fucking someone eleven years younger than her.

Even getting herself out of this rut (heh) wouldn't be worth violating her moral code. Although, as she watched Dan walk away, she couldn't help but notice his butt filled out his khakis quite nicely. Had it always been that shapely? Or maybe he'd put on a little weight and had a cute little belly to go with it. Soft to the touch and sensitive to boot, perfect for--

She groaned, shook her head. "Get a grip, you nymphomaniac..."

------

One breakfast platter later, Pamela trudged home. Again, none of the people she passed by gave her more than a quick glance. It especially hurt when it was someone she knew. Vince, the Kadabra; Iolana, the Decidueye... Even Jack, the studly Machamp. They used to go at it about once a week! What happened to that?!

Returning to her condo brought no comfort. It was one of the large rooms the complex offered, generally reserved for larger species. Though not on the same level as an Onix or a Snorlax, Pamela was just too tall and shapely to fit comfortably in anything smaller. This resulted in a living space with more than enough room to accommodate.

It also resulted in her feeling awful lonely.

"What's changed?" she asked her reflection before pacing about her bedroom. "I'm as sexy as ever, as friendly as ever... What am I doing wrong? Arceus above, even high school me had an easier time with this!"

Ah, high school. A turbulent time of growth, self-discovery, more growth, experimentation, even more growth, and developing and refining the skills that made Pamela such an effective seductress. By graduation, she'd at least made out with most of the student body (plus a few teachers, something her adult self regretted) and cemented her status as a queen of lust and sexuality. And she was just a Nidorina back then!

It was all so new and exciting back then. College was fun too, but by that point she'd fallen into a routine of sorts. With everyone being legal adults, sex stopped being this tempting taboo and became another fact of life. She evolved into a Nidoqueen and dabbled in a kink here or there, but it was more or less a repeat of high school. Same for her adult life.

Wait.

Pamela stopped pacing. "That's it," she whispered. She returned to her mirror. "Nothing's changed. And that's the problem."

Complacency. Routine. Just because she hadn't grown tired of it didn't mean others wouldn't. Even her regular partners would get sick of it eventually without something to shake things up. There's no pleasure if they just went through the motions. Release, sure, but no satisfaction beyond that. And it certainly didn't help that she had one of the biggest libidos in all of Kanto, if not the world.

"Well no way I'm letting this continue," she declared to her reflection, which mirrored her determined expression. "Things are gonna change. Maybe I can't get that old first time magic back, but I'll get as close as I can!"

Turning to her window, she placed one hand on her hip and clenched the other into a fist. "Queen Pamela is making a comeback!"
